Angelic Chorus.description: While choral angels are content to sing their hymns in Nirvana, they must sometimes take to the mortal realm to provide needed succor for those engaged in righteous battle against the wicked. An angelic chorus often acts as support for armies who have gained the favor of the celestial realms.

7GGKYj0XvXO8RIX5.description: The angelic choir raises their voices in song, singing a note that vibrates the very fabric of being. This takes the form of a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] within 90 feet that deals @Damage[6d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:deafened] save). A creature who critically fails the save is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute. When the angelic chorus is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:10].
7GGKYj0XvXO8RIX5.name: Admonishing Hymn

ARm9JqD3DFsJH9sb.description: When the angelic chorus Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that deals sonic damage, that spell gains a status bonus to damage equal to its rank.
ARm9JqD3DFsJH9sb.name: Harmonized Spellcasting

IGvKRatzTPUtOGBv.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect With sonorous shouts, the angelic chorus lashes out with their fists in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions

1 @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning],1d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]{1d8 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 sonic damage}

2 @Damage[(2d8+7)[bludgeoning],2d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]{2d8+7 bludgeoning damage plus 2d6 sonic damage}

3 @Damage[(3d8+10)[bludgeoning],2d6[sonic]|options:area-damage]{3d8+10 bludgeoning damage plus 2d6 sonic damage}
IGvKRatzTPUtOGBv.name: Righteous Clamor

Angelic Chorus.name: Angelic Chorus
Angelic Chorus.npcHp: (4 segments); Thresholds 210 (4 segments); Thresholds 140 (3 segments), 70 (2 segments)

Animated Army.description: Animated statues usually appear in pairs or alone, hiding in plain sight among the other decor. Occasionally, a creator will fashion dozens of animated statues to serve as a nigh-unstoppable fighting force that doesn't complain or tire.

Cd6eDbFtKZ0Y74bp.description: Like normal objects, the animated statues of the animated army have Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the animated army takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated army is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 23.
Cd6eDbFtKZ0Y74bp.name: Construct Armor

CwU8AcG0B5BhuCVr.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The animated army makes a melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+8)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage
CwU8AcG0B5BhuCVr.name: Battering Fists

Animated Army.name: Animated Army
Animated Army.npcHp: (4 segments); Thresholds 120 (4 segments); Thresholds 80 (3 segments), 40 (2 segments)

Apprentice Magician Clique.description: Students at academies that teach magic sometimes form fast friendships. When not studying or blowing off steam together, these cliques might be called to defend their place of learning from outside attack.

298SOrPtZWcvtOhq.description: The apprentice magicians launch shards of pure magic at all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 120 feet. This barrage deals @Damage[5d4[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the clique is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
298SOrPtZWcvtOhq.name: Barrage of Force

bbuOUmrCvWVMuNcJ.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The apprentice magicians wave wands that shoot out minor bolts of electricity at short range. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+3)[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d8+7)[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage
bbuOUmrCvWVMuNcJ.name: Sparking Wands

zr4cOSOQ86KFbjyD.description: When the apprentice magician clique Casts a Spell, its members pool their arcane power into the spell. A creature who critically fails their save against the spell or whom the clique hits with a critical spell attack is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.
zr4cOSOQ86KFbjyD.name: Clique Spellcasting

Apprentice Magician Clique.name: Apprentice Magician Clique

Arboreal Copse.description: Though arboreal wardens typically remain within the boundaries of the forests they protect, they occasionally gather into copses to seek information about potential threats to report back to arboreal regents. Arboreals are typically slow to act, but copses must sometimes make quick judgment calls when faced with imminent dangers.

AwWx7DridTlHkpo8.description:
The arboreal copse uses their blunt stone longswords to pummel its foes. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|optionsarea-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+1)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage
AwWx7DridTlHkpo8.name: Sword Bash

BVopnCZzSNujoI5t.description: The arboreal copse Strides. All enemies whose square the copse begins in or passes through during their movement take @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:forced-movement]). On a failed saving throw, the arboreal copse carries the creature along on their shields, moving them in the same distance and direction for the rest of their Stride.
BVopnCZzSNujoI5t.name: Shoving Shield Wall

rcGFpY9bZDxpvUJ2.description: The arboreal wardens of the copse raise their shields in tandem, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saves.
rcGFpY9bZDxpvUJ2.name: Raise Shields

uvjlEBAqOy2l2myB.description:
Trigger An enemy within 5 feet of the arboreal copse uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The arboreals swing their stone swords. The triggering enemy takes @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save). If the creature critically fails their saving throw and the trigger was a manipulate action, the troop disrupts that action.
uvjlEBAqOy2l2myB.name: Reactive Attack

Arboreal Copse.name: Arboreal Copse

Archer Regiment.description: Archer regiments are capable of filling the sky with arrows at great distances, making them vital to any war leader who wishes to weaken the enemy before they get close to allied units or encampments.

8AcivAl6LMDAhval.description:
The archer regiment draws daggers to attack close-range enemies. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. The archer regiment gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of their next turn.

1 @Damage[(2d4+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d4+12)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d4+15)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
8AcivAl6LMDAhval.name: Dagger Defense

R51FceAqG8YYfUtl.description: The archer regiment fires their longbows in a coordinated volley. This volley is either a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] within 200 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage or a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 100 feet that deals @Damage[6d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage. Either effect has a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the archer regiment is reduced to 2 segments, both areas are reduced by 5 feet.
R51FceAqG8YYfUtl.name: Rain of Arrows

VulwEYPqDylG33H9.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The archer regiment uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.USyDPcSdzcm024zT]{Change Formation}. An archer regiment unit typically knows the loose and marching column formations.
VulwEYPqDylG33H9.name: Drilled in Formations

Archer Regiment.name: Archer Regiment

Archon Bastion.description: Rekheps, also known as shield archons, stand against any fiendish onslaughts on Heaven, but occasionally travel to the mortal Universe to protect the weak. Large formations of rekheps are a sight to behold as they lock their shield forms in place to face the wicked.

544dEwQrlWt2mwzj.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The archon bastion engages in a uniform melee attack against each enemy in @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions. An unholy creature that fails its save against this effect takes an additional @Damage[2d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage (or @Damage[1d6[spirit]|options:area-damage] damage for the one-action version).

1 @Damage[(1d8+4)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(3d8+14)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d8+19)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
544dEwQrlWt2mwzj.name: Smiting Lances

AurAKcqtjnEcr4Yi.description:
The archon bastion grants each ally within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until that ally is no longer within the area or until the start of the archon bastion's next turn, whichever comes first. If the archon bastion uses Archon's Aegis against an attack against one of the shielded allies, the archon bastion gains the resistance and takes the damage rather than the ally.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.NXnngvaJXHtskVjU]{Effect: Living Shields}
AurAKcqtjnEcr4Yi.name: Living Shields

HxFuQk0JpWsvbABp.description:
Trigger An enemy damages an ally of the archon bastion and both are within 15 feet of the archon bastion

Effect The ally gains resistance 20 to all damage against the triggering damage and the enemy takes @Damage[(1d8+4)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic] save).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.w74r3xO0rsowT5ra]{Effect: Archon's Aegis}
HxFuQk0JpWsvbABp.name: Archon's Aegis

vaIAtDX85EGJM624.description: The archon bastion Strides so that at least one of its segments occupies the same space of a Large or smaller willing ally. That willing ally is then teleported to any open space it can fit into that is adjacent to any of the archon bastion's segments, using teleportation magic innate to the troop's individual shield archons. The archon bastion can move up to three allies in this fashion.
vaIAtDX85EGJM624.name: Fearless Switch

Archon Bastion.name: Archon Bastion

Boggard Dreadknot.description: The boggard cavalry wields clubs as they ride giant frogs into battle, often ranging out of their swamp homelands to strike fear into the hearts of their enemies.

3B62IJtohsC40PBN.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the boggard dreadknot, subject to the GM's discretion.
3B62IJtohsC40PBN.name: Mounted Troop

FLM2nudormV08hBs.description: The dreadknot's giant frogs lash out at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] with their tongues, requiring them to succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. A creature grabbed in this way isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move more than 15 feet from the dreadknot. A creature can sever one of the tongues with a Strike against AC 25 that deals at least 15 slashing damage. This doesn't deal damage to the dreadknot.
FLM2nudormV08hBs.name: Tongue Lashing

P7BbgkbC8XZ9bU1X.description: The dreadknot draws javelins and launches a coordinated barrage. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the dreadknot is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
P7BbgkbC8XZ9bU1X.name: Javelin Barrage

YIQIuTTrnRTLS3kt.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The boggard dreadknot pummels each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with their clubs, with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(3d6+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d6+13)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage
YIQIuTTrnRTLS3kt.name: Batrachian Blitz

oJPw0n4DdxpkVNlK.description: The boggard dreadknot unleashes a chorus of terrifying croaks. Any non-boggard within 30 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.
oJPw0n4DdxpkVNlK.name: Chorus of Croaks

x9EwNYVrQ0Hm6zKF.description: A boggard dreadknot ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.
x9EwNYVrQ0Hm6zKF.name: Swamp Passage

Boggard Dreadknot.name: Boggard Dreadknot

Boggard Scouting Party.description: Boggard scouting parties run ahead of other boggard troops to get the lay of the land. They sometimes engage if they think they can quickly vanquish an enemy force.

6n1YNpA9sckKPpwJ.description: The boggard scouting party unleashes a chorus of terrifying croaks. Any non-boggard within 30 feet becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21|options:area-effect,inflicts:frightened] save; those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.
6n1YNpA9sckKPpwJ.name: Chorus of Croaks

HbU9kLWy2ILILzTj.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The boggards execute coordinated melee attacks against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+7)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+11)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage
HbU9kLWy2ILILzTj.name: Morningstar Massacre

VBT6H5puqPRiwRvD.description: A boggard scouting party ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.
VBT6H5puqPRiwRvD.name: Swamp Passage

qaBL38g5CJeGHGUZ.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Several boggards use their tongues to grapple an enemy within 10 feet to pull them closer. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save. On a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and pulled 5 feet closer to the scouting party. A creature grabbed in this way isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move more than 10 feet from the scouting party. A creature can sever one of the tongues with a Strike against AC 21 that deals at least 5 slashing damage. This doesn't damage the scouting party.
qaBL38g5CJeGHGUZ.name: Coordinated Tongue Pull

qt8qxclrefUDCgL5.description: The dreadknot draws and loads slings to launch a coordinated barrage. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 50 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the scouting party is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
qt8qxclrefUDCgL5.name: Sling Barrage

Boggard Scouting Party.name: Boggard Scouting Party

Charau-ka Shrieker Crew.description: Charau-ka are small humanoid apes who live in tropical jungles, especially within the Mwangi Expanse. Shrieker crews patrol the canopies close to charau-ka settlements, keeping predators at bay. Sometimes, a group of charau-ka will devote themselves to the demon lord Angazhan and become a bloodthirsty hunting party.

PFzoUN8ccxYZxbWd.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The charau-ka engage in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+10)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d6+13)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage
PFzoUN8ccxYZxbWd.name: Frenzied Hatchets

jg2h9ZuElYd5GVNb.description: With raucous shrieks, the shrieker crew charges forward. The troop Strides twice. If they move at least 10 feet, the crew deals @Damage[(3d6+13)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] at the end of the crew's movement. Each target who fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.
jg2h9ZuElYd5GVNb.name: Shrieking Charge

uYsOWXvUohnIoJuN.description: The charau-ka hurl daggers as a ranged attack in the form of a barrage. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[5d4[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The range increases by 15 feet if the charau-ka are above their targets. When the shrieker crew is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
uYsOWXvUohnIoJuN.name: Storm of Daggers

Charau-ka Shrieker Crew.name: Charau-ka Shrieker Crew

Clockwork Infantry.description: With each unit being 500 pounds of metal and magic, a clockwork infantry is a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield. Needing no food, shelter, or rest and feeling no pain, clockwork infantry can advance where living units have great trouble. With no morale that can be broken or minds that can be beguiled, they patrol without stopping and show no mercy. The only drawback is the need to wind them more often than simpler clockwork mechanics.

HSCg5KpZvlnFPxrU.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The clockwork soldiers of the infantry extend external plates on mechanical actuators to defend the troop or an adjacent creature. The creature gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of the infantry's next turn, or until it is no longer adjacent to the infantry, whichever comes first.
HSCg5KpZvlnFPxrU.name: Raise Defenses

WsoRfLNjWzAs0wwC.description:
24 hours, [[/act disable-device dc=27]], standy

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
WsoRfLNjWzAs0wwC.name: Wind-Up

bcpOku7PiXdT4H8M.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The clockwork infantry engages in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d10+2)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d10+10)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d10+12)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage
bcpOku7PiXdT4H8M.name: Halberd Sweep

na8p3W8S14jn8Qiz.description:
Trigger An enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square in the area during a move action it's using

Effect The clockwork infantry lashes out with their halberds. The triggering enemy takes @Damage[(2d10+10)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save). If the enemy critically fails this saving throw and the trigger was a manipulate action, the damage disrupts that action.
na8p3W8S14jn8Qiz.name: Reactive Sweep

Clockwork Infantry.name: Clockwork Infantry

Clockwork Runner Pack.description: Clockwork runners are units build for speed. Mimicking large cats, they sacrifice sturdiness for agility. Runners provide excellent battlefield control by speedily traversing diverse terrain types, able to cut off enemy units and provide covering fire for allies with their built-in crossbows. As clockworks, they do need to be rewound, making them less ideal for longer deployments.

Hh1zN6n8JRhOzsdT.description: The clockwork runners reload the crossbows built onto their backs, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 120 feet that deals @Damage[2d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the clockwork runners are reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
Hh1zN6n8JRhOzsdT.name: Fire Crossbows

48 hours, [[/act disable-device dc=19]], standy

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
IWRYdtXAJ49GqLfB.name: Wind-Up

gBzSzuaHS6SO6ebY.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The clockwork runner pack Strides, ignoring difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain). At the end of this movement, each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[1d8[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save).
gBzSzuaHS6SO6ebY.name: War Pounce

lQ7JmilKyrxwRdga.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The clockwork runners engage in a pack attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d8[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+3)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d8+7)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage
lQ7JmilKyrxwRdga.name: Scratch and Bite

Clockwork Runner Pack.name: Clockwork Runner Pack

Deinonychus Pack.description: Deinonychuses are widely known and feared both for the razor-sharp claws with which they savagely disembowel their prey and for their unmatched mastery of pack tactics, which enables determined deinonychus packs to consistently bring down prey much larger than themselves. Some iruxi and xulgath communities train these dinosaurs to act as battlefield skirmishers, weakening their enemies with hit-and-run tactics before closing in for the kill.

6PukXd6ei7NiNQfG.description:
Bleeding creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to Reflex saves against a deinonychus pack's Jaws and Claws.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c5zOwEre2Uy9MCFo]{Effect: Predator's Advantage}
6PukXd6ei7NiNQfG.name: Predator's Advantage

Ly6erR1zh1HAnKJ5.description:
Requirements The deinonychus pack has at least 3 segments

Effect The pack Strides, positioning its segments so that at least two of them are adjacent to the same creature, and lashes out with its talons. That creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or take @Damage[2d4[persistent,bleed]] damage.
Ly6erR1zh1HAnKJ5.name: Surround Prey

zd0ZnYdWNyaLP8Au.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The pack makes a melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

3b4Rr0cjQ5WiCa61.description: When the dezullon thicket's regeneration raises its Hit Points above a listed threshold after losing a segment for dropping below it, the thicket immediately regains that lost segment.

A dezullon thicket can Grapple as many creatures as it has remaining segments, though it needs to spend an action to extend the duration on subsequent rounds. These attempts neither apply nor count toward the creature's multiple attack penalty.

rY4LPbBX9V5R7RBL.description: Until the next time it acts, the dezullon thicket appears to be a field of normal pitcher plants. It has an automatic result of 49 (53 in forests or swamps) on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a grove of non-creature plants.

yhqrLAWULs5GIiU6.description: The dezullon thicket discharges a cascade of acidic digestive juices as a ranged attack, dealing @Damage[6d6[acid]|options:area-damage,inflicts:amnesia-venom] damage in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save) and exposing any creature struck to amnesia venom. Drake Flight.description: Though drakes from different biomes rarely interact with one another due to geographical distance, a powerful creature, ancient artifact, or natural catastrophe could bring together multiple types of drakes into a single terrifying, living catastrophe. Such a flight can be a terror to behold on the battlefield.

FUmBqO0V8PxJ39YL.description: Certain drakes within the flight bring their breath weapon (or similar ability) to bear, exhaling energy that explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] within 120 feet. This explosion deals @Damage[5d6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage (acid, cold, fire, or poison damage); the ability gains the corresponding trait. The drake flight can't choose the same damage type until it uses this ability with a different damage type. When the drakes are reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:10].
FUmBqO0V8PxJ39YL.name: Drake Breath

WWmwctWaT06hNzMR.description:
The drakes frenzy, lashing out with fangs and tails. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

2 @Damage[(3d8+10)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d8+14)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage
WWmwctWaT06hNzMR.name: Draconic Onslaught

Dromaar Company.description: Numerous dromaar mercenary companies operate in and around Belkzen, providing their strength at arms to any hold that requests their services. These disciplined warriors march confidently into battle, bringing their axes to bear against all who stand in their way.

Effect The dromaars coordinate melee attacks with their axes against all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d8[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d8+10)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

A creature who fails this saving throw is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Druid Circle.description: In their role as protectors of the wild and unspoiled areas of the world, powerful druids might gather together to stand against a particularly heinous threat.

GiP41mP0LnZ0XTGl.description: When the druid circle Casts a Spell, its constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.
GiP41mP0LnZ0XTGl.name: Troop Spellcasting

Dwarven armies employ longshot squads as the first line of defense, especially outside of cramped tunnels and subterranean caverns.

This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] within 120 feet that deals @Damage[6d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] saving throw. Dwarf Longshot Squad (Guns).description:
While many dwarves train to master hammers and shields, others seek to become masters of ranged weapons, usually sturdy and dwarven-built crossbows. Dwarven armies employ longshot squads as the first line of defense, especially outside of cramped tunnels and subterranean caverns.

Longshot with Guns

Dwarves from Dongun Hold and similar places have access to firearms, and you might choose to reflect this by giving the dwarf longshot squad rifles. Adjust the stat block to have the uncommon trait and replace mentions of "crossbows" to "rifles" and "bolts" to "bullets." In addition, give the Bolts from the Blue action the concussive trait, meaning that it deals bludgeoning or piercing damage, whichever would be more detrimental to each target (you may also want to refer to it as "Bullets from the Blue"). Finally, replace Hampering Fusillade with the following ability.

Bullet Smog 2 The dwarven longshots fire their rifles in rapid succession to create a cloud of smoke within 120 feet. This cloud is a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] and lasts for 1 minute or until it is dispersed by a strong wind, whichever comes first. All creatures within the cloud become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the cloud become concealed to creatures within it.

First-Class Infantry.description: Soldiers who participate in multiple campaigns of war gain the experience necessary to become their military's finest fighting forces. First-class infantry troops are deployed on battlefields where winning the day is of the utmost importance.

B4GNybKzTfM43wAU.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The first-class infantry attacks each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

3 @Damage[(4d6+18)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

Any time they would be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, the first-class infantry is instead @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for the same duration.

bDE87FD5U7tvqvaA.description: The first-class infantry draws, loads, and shoots a salvo from their crossbows. The salvo is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 120 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the first-class infantry is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
bDE87FD5U7tvqvaA.name: Bolt Salvo

vklePDp4ChdoOuoW.description: The first-class infantry rushes forward with a hunger for battle. They Stride up to twice their Speed. At the end of their movement, each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[(2d6+5)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage, with a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save.

A creature who critically fails their saving throw takes @Damage[1d8[persistent,acid]|options:area-damage] damage. When the troop is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[2d10+6[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:forced-movement]). A creature who fails the save is also pushed 5 feet away from the amalgam.
Ra4zH2Y2fsG6xxMp.name: Brutal Retaliation

mwaDMdReJdQ1woD5.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The fleshwarps make wild melee attacks against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d10[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

Gargoyle Wing.description: Normally solitary beasts that lurk in abandoned temples and other structures that afford them a place to hide among appropriately monstrous statuary, gargoyles occasionally band together to hunt challenging prey or simply to take communal pleasure in slaughtering the defenseless. Called wings, these groupings are usually short-lived, though that matters little to those who fall victim to their predations in the meantime.

FRbuLqAKh0PNhfBK.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The gargoyle wing rips and tears with their stony talons at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage
FRbuLqAKh0PNhfBK.name: Raking Swoop

grfypKAmBW7H9dWz.description: The gargoyle wing attempts an Athletics checks to [[/act grapple]], comparing the result to the Fortitude DC of a number of Large or smaller creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] equal to the gargoyle wing's remaining number of segments, then Flies up to 40 feet, bringing any successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} creatures along, and Releases them.
grfypKAmBW7H9dWz.name: Catch and Release

scPsVJgp3B51KjMF.description:
Trigger The gargoyle wing is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it

scPsVJgp3B51KjMF.name: Death From Above

Gargoyle Wing.name: Gargoyle Wing

Giant Ant Army.description: Like their tiny counterparts, colonies of giant ants often form vast armies that launch regular campaigns into the lands surrounding their nests to forage for food and expand their territory. Though their primary targets are usually rival colonies, a giant ant army that happens upon a humanoid settlement will not hesitate to overrun and strip it of resources to bring back to their queen, taking a particular interest in the settlement's former inhabitants.

0GB6weL7oSMiYNhj.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} (1 round)
0GB6weL7oSMiYNhj.name: Giant Ant Venom

7p3yhWfqW3H1Z7e3.description: The giant ant army swarms over a Large or larger creature that it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, pinning the creature in place and causing it to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} until the start of the giant ant army's next turn or until it Escapes. A creature that begins its turn restrained by the army is repeatedly stung by the clinging ants, automatically taking @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage and suffering the effects of giant ant venom.
7p3yhWfqW3H1Z7e3.name: Overwhelm

AUF1bsMkqxZPLcoF.description:
Requirements The giant ant army has at least one creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The army Strides up to its Speed, carrying any restrained creatures with it. If the creature is Gargantuan, the giant ant army is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Encumbered}.
AUF1bsMkqxZPLcoF.name: Haul Away

sc3x5FE9ukgewtV4.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The army makes a savage bite attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d8[slashing]|options:area-damage,grasping-mandibles] damage plus Grasping Mandibles

2 @Damage[(2d8+6)[slashing]|options:area-damage,grasping-mandibles] damage plus Grasping Mandibles

3 @Damage[(2d8+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage
sc3x5FE9ukgewtV4.name: Mandible Frenzy

yA8PCCPpx4NOi1T8.description:
Requirements The giant ant army's last action was a Mandible Frenzy that at least one creature failed their save against or the giant ant army has at least one creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

The giant any army can instead use Grasping Mandibles to choose one creature it's grabbing or restraining to automatically extend that condition to the end of the army's next turn.
