Giant Ant Army.name: Giant Ant Army

Gnome Cannon Corps.description: Inventive gnomes blend engineering and fey magic to create wondrous cannons, whose colorful blasts dazzle foes while creating areas of warped terrain. Only the cleverest generals understand how to use cannon corps to great advantage in unconventional warfare.

CEKjsBaoB9qScWqZ.description: Aiming the gnome cannons toward the enemy, loading them, and firing them requires the troop's full attention. The cannons fire a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] of bright magic within 200 feet that deals @Damage[(2d12+2)[force]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect,light,visual] save). A creature that fails their save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round; this is a light and visual effect. The area of the explosion seems to twist and ripple for 1 minute afterward. A creature that attempts to move through the space must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or treat the area as difficult terrain; this is an illusion and visual effect.
CEKjsBaoB9qScWqZ.name: Arcane Explosion

PVMF2htb8MLPe6yb.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The gnome engineers vent the cannons' energy in a blast that hits all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+2)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+8)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d6+10)[fire]|options:area-damage] damage
PVMF2htb8MLPe6yb.name: Cannon Vent

yKejA13gzals79JS.description: The gnomes fire a more mundane round from one of their cannons at a single target within 60 feet, who takes @Damage[(3d10+6)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:inflicts:forced-movement] save). On a failed save, the creature is also pushed 5 feet away from the troop.
yKejA13gzals79JS.name: Direct Hit

Gnome Cannon Corps.name: Gnome Cannon Corps

Goblin Rabble.description: Goblins lack the organization and discipline of their hobgoblin cousins but often more than make up for it with guile. Some goblin tribes like to terrorize trade routes under the cover of dusk. Focused on stripping valuables and escaping rather than finishing a fight, these groups of goblins excel at speed and identifying things of value to strip from their bewildered prey, using hit-and-run tactics since they tend to be outmatched more often than not.

7XYw0EuPpuxTe0VW.description:
The goblin rabble hamstring and hobble as many enemies as possible. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a –5-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds.

Failure The creature takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes a –15-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds and is slowed 1.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.lvK0DAuTYOnT6E5f]{Effect: Hobble Pursuit}
7XYw0EuPpuxTe0VW.name: Hobble Pursuit

8fqpfYBxFIhGzamm.description: Quickly moving in with grasping hands, the goblin rabble take what they can. The goblin rabble Strides up to twice their Speed. During this movement, the goblins Interact to pick up an unattended object no larger than 2 Bulk or attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} an item from a creature they are adjacent to; the goblins can pick up or Steal as many objects as they have remaining segments in any combination.
8fqpfYBxFIhGzamm.name: Rush and Steal

eRRRtU4JqLtCwvrs.description:
The goblin rabble engage in as coordinated an attack as they can with their dogslicers, attacking each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save). The damage depends on the number of actions. A creature who critically fails their save is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+4)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+7)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage
eRRRtU4JqLtCwvrs.name: Dogpile

Goblin Rabble.name: Goblin Rabble

i2KxZTYPEzdd6zHZ.description:
When the halfling lucky draw Casts a Spell that targets a single creature, some of the constituent members can perform a focused Harrow reading on the target as part of Casting the Spell. The lucky draw attempts an @Check[occultism|against:will] skill check against the target's Will DC. On a success, the target takes a –1 status penalty to their saving throw or AC against the spell (–2 on a critical success). If the lucky draw critically fails this check, their reading portends bad news for the halflings and they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.GZAVAOj0s73Swc0e]{Effect: Troop Harrowing}
i2KxZTYPEzdd6zHZ.name: Troop Harrowing

ntqLuao5Yr7uqE8V.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The halflings feint with their cards and then lash out with their daggers in a coordinated melee attack against enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d4[piercing],1d4[precision]|options:area-damage] precision damage

2 @Damage[(2d4+7)[piercing],2d4[precision]|options:area-damage] precision damage

3 @Damage[(3d4+10)[piercing],2d4[precision]|options:area-damage] precision damage
ntqLuao5Yr7uqE8V.name: False Cuts

q3zI9N0p1dOqMF4D.description:
The halflings mock and taunt their enemies with quick Harrow readings that predict doom. The troop chooses a number of creatures equal to the number of its remaining segments within 60 feet. Each target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save. On a failure, the target must roll their next attack roll, saving throw, or skill check twice and use the worse result.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.U37oY6akeNfTtgLk]{Effect: Bad Deal}
q3zI9N0p1dOqMF4D.name: Bad Deal

Hell Hound Pack.description: Frequently deployed on the battlefield alongside vordine legions, hell hound packs distract and weaken enemy forces to provide their masters with a tactical advantage. While not intelligent enough to employ advanced maneuvers, well-trained hell hounds are adept at using their flaming breath to control the battlefield by separating enemy units from their allies or forcing them into less favorable positions, leaving them easy prey for other fiendish troops.

dvQkVHhgqq97vdBL.description: The hell hounds in the pack combine their efforts to bathe the battlefield in hellish flame, dealing @Damage[2d10[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in two @Template[type:cone|distance:15]s (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save) that can't overlap. The hell hound pack can't use Hellfire Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. If the pack would take fire damage or be targeted by a fire effect, its Hellfire Breath recharges.
dvQkVHhgqq97vdBL.name: Hellfire Breath

gOwqkgU2f7IIIUcd.description:
Trigger The hell hound pack is critically hit by a Strike or spell attack

Effect The hell hound pack's Hellfire Breath recharges. They can immediately use it as part of this reaction.
gOwqkgU2f7IIIUcd.name: Hellish Revenge

jOde80XOr56srQBs.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The pack tears into each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with their flaming jaws (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d4[piercing],1d6[fire]|options:area-damage]{1d4 piercing damage plus 1d6 fire damage}

2 @Damage[(1d8+7)[piercing],2d6[fire]|options:area-damage]{1d8+7 piercing damage plus 2d6 fire damage}

3 @Damage[(2d8+7)[piercing],2d6[fire]|options:area-damage]{2d8+7 piercing damage plus 2d6 fire damage}
jOde80XOr56srQBs.name: Infernal Mauling

Hell Hound Pack.name: Hell Hound Pack

Hobgoblin Veteran Regiment.description: There are few sights as intimidating as a regiment of well-armed hobgoblin soldiers advancing across a battlefield. Exceptionally capable of defending themselves and tenacious to a fault, such hobgoblins are used as a precision tool, exploiting the enemy's weakest point and tearing it wide open to collapse entire defensive lines.

4GrQnnekkVGJNJRk.description: The hobgoblin veteran regiment marches inexorably forward, crushing enemies in their path. The regiment Strides up to double its Speed and can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures, dealing @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save) to each creature whose space it enters. The regiment can attempt to Overrun the same creature only once in a single use of Overrun. When the regiment is reduced to 2 segments, the damage decreases to @Damage[(1d8+2)[slashing]] damage.
4GrQnnekkVGJNJRk.name: Overrun

NYRyHo1jTrJN4bQS.description: The hobgoblin regiment is trained to guard from all sides with shields at the ready. The hobgoblin regiment can't be made @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} by flanking creatures of the troop's level or lower.
NYRyHo1jTrJN4bQS.name: Watchful

O2lSwgbjBHqj1RP2.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The hobgoblins engage in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage
O2lSwgbjBHqj1RP2.name: Disciplined Strikes

Tt4mUW9Ms8d5hw9m.description: Many of the hobgoblins raise their shields to protect their allies. The regiment gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.
Tt4mUW9Ms8d5hw9m.name: Hobgoblin Phalanx

unbuSuEJCHdIxDeZ.description: The hobgoblins draw their shortbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet that deals @Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the regiment is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
unbuSuEJCHdIxDeZ.name: Shortbow Volley

Hobgoblin Veteran Regiment.name: Hobgoblin Veteran Regiment

Kobold Trap Squad.description: Kobold trap squads generally protect their warrens, but these groups sometimes range outside of their lairs at the behest of a powerful patron. Their goals are usually to scout a given location, but they can be tasked with procuring an item or resource for the good of the warren.

iana8aSR0WrAjjvs.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The kobold trap squad engages in a coordinated melee attack against all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
iana8aSR0WrAjjvs.name: Spear Jabs

saCHZrL12xRzQ6S0.description: The kobolds draw their slings, then launch a ranged barrage of stones. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 50 feet that deals @Damage[3d4[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the squad is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
saCHZrL12xRzQ6S0.name: Sling Barrage

wXMVIRjPi2YzTdR0.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The kobolds Stride up to their Speed plus 5 feet and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. If they end this movement with at least 1 segment adjacent to any enemy, the squad is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of its next turn.
wXMVIRjPi2YzTdR0.name: Group Scamper

z3HQYCUmAo0o9v2u.description:
The kobolds hastily prepare a handful of rudimentary traps in their vicinity until the beginning of their next turn. The next creature who moves adjacent to the trap squad triggers a trap and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage (@Damage[2d4[persistent,bleed]] damage on a critical failure). A creature taking persistent bleed damage from Hasty Traps takes a –5-foot enhancement penalty to its Speed. This occurs to as many creatures as the kobold trap squad has segments when it performed the action, but a single creature can trigger only one trap per turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.JUo3BTRaRHkL9ZBC]{Effect: Hasty Traps}
z3HQYCUmAo0o9v2u.name: Hasty Traps

Kobold Trap Squad.name: Kobold Trap Squad

Leukodaemon Plague.description: Daemons are shaped by, and devoted to, the destruction of life in all its forms. Leukodaemons serve the Apocalypse Rider of Pestilence, spreading disease across the Universe with their very touch. A small army of leukodaemons has the potential to wipe out a small country—or more—if left unchecked.

7hZjrMBROsN3W5TY.description: 30 feet. Leukodaemons radiate infection. All creatures within 30 feet of a leukodaemon plague take a –2 status penalty to saves against disease. If a creature within range contracts or progresses a disease, all adjacent creatures are exposed to the same disease, at the same DC.
7hZjrMBROsN3W5TY.name: Infectious Aura

8PW6b8iI5mex49kK.description:
The leukodaemon plague can telepathically communicate with the afflicted creature at any distance on the same plane

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:34]

Stage 1 carrier (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 drained 2 (1 day)

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 week)

Stage 6 dead
8PW6b8iI5mex49kK.name: Daemonic Pestilence

PLYfuYiAgz5PdpwR.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leukodaemons unleash an onslaught of blows against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d10+3)[untyped]] damage plus daemonic pestilence

2 @Damage[(3d10+9)[untyped]] damage plus daemonic pestilence

3 @Damage[(4d10+12)[untyped]] damage plus daemonic pestilence
PLYfuYiAgz5PdpwR.name: Infected Jaws and Claws

XqqRGyvjZZYyQtDp.description: A leukodaemon plague senses any creature with a disease, and knows the type and current stage of all diseases carried by any creature within range.
XqqRGyvjZZYyQtDp.name: Plaguesense

YDQqHGqRddR5xBdx.description: The leukodaemons coax a disease into full bloom. They choose a target within their infectious aura that's currently affected by a disease. That creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the disease as if the interval for the disease's current stage had passed.
YDQqHGqRddR5xBdx.name: Quicken Pestilence

ZsLTGrtulHpBQjCi.description: The leukodaemons exhale a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of disease-ridden black flies that deal @Damage[5d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:sickened] save). A creature that fails the save also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). When the leukodaemon plague is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:cone|distance:20].
ZsLTGrtulHpBQjCi.name: Pestilent Wheeze

Leukodaemon Plague.name: Leukodaemon Plague

A4OVN3F7XvIf893o.description:
When the lich legion Casts a Spell, their constituent members combine their efforts into casting a more powerful version of the spell than any one member could achieve alone. When Casting a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and doesn't have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

If a reaction would disrupt the lich legion's spellcasting action, the lich legion attempts a @Check[flat|dc:12]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.
A4OVN3F7XvIf893o.name: Steady Troop Spellcasting

PAVLwZnLqEhiWI7u.description: This functions similarly to a lich's rejuvenation ability, though with all the liches of a legion returning as a troop thanks to a collective @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qFVPeeJ70B1u2n81]{Soul Cage}, which is a level 18 item that has Hardness 15 and 54 Hit Points.
PAVLwZnLqEhiWI7u.name: Mass Rejuvenation

qXZ45E5MWpjGvtE7.description:
Trigger A creature within the legion's sight casts a spell the legion has prepared

Effect The lich legion expends a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. The lich legion loses the spell slot as if they had cast the triggering spell. The lich legion then attempts to counteract the triggering spell with a +2 status bonus to the counteract check.
qXZ45E5MWpjGvtE7.name: Troop Counterspell

zNngRDMNalyBs1dp.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The lich legion touches all enemies within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] to drain their life (@Check[reflex|dc:37|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions. For each action the lich legion uses, the legion gains 10 temporary Hit Points that last 1 minute.

1 @Damage[2d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d8+11)[void]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(6d8+13)[void]|options:area-damage] damage
zNngRDMNalyBs1dp.name: Siphoning Grip

Mitflit Vermin Cavalry.description: Though mitflits are known as cowardly gremlins, they can be urged into an aggressive fervor by the right leader. Mounted on giant ticks, centipedes, and other verminous arthropods, these mitflits overcome their self-loathing to take the fight to their enemies.

9w4raGfyxBVkVKDT.description: As long as it's not frightened, the mitflit vermin cavalry gains a +2 status bonus to the DC of its Crawling Stabs ability against creatures that have previously damaged or tormented it.
9w4raGfyxBVkVKDT.name: Vengeful Wrath

AYEfCOwUzittbzFm.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the mitflit vermin cavalry, subject to the GM's discretion.
AYEfCOwUzittbzFm.name: Mounted Troop

P6s1HQwegXyFaIih.description: The mitflit vermin cavalry Leaps up to 30 feet. If it moves at least 15 feet, the cavalry deals @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] at the end of its movement.
P6s1HQwegXyFaIih.name: Leaping Charge

pdDjyRubh4JykjK1.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The mitflits thrust with their shortswords, coordinated with bites from their giant vermin mounts. All enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+8)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
pdDjyRubh4JykjK1.name: Crawling Stabs

Mitflit Vermin Cavalry.name: Mitflit Vermin Cavalry

Monk Cadre.description: Many martial artists train to defend themselves and their allies against unwanted aggression, but sometimes the circumstances dictate that even the most peaceful monks must go to war. A cadre of studied monks is capable of dishing out great damage with punches and kicks, as well as focusing their qi into ranged blasts.

2KuVzTYLKCWJAiw3.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The monks perform well-timed coordinated melee attacks against all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d8+8)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d8+16)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage
2KuVzTYLKCWJAiw3.name: Pummeling Punches

Kne0fCu271kBT4tl.description: The monks channel their qi into an explosion of energy that affects all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet. This explosion deals @Damage[6d6[force]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:31|basic|options:area-damage] save. When the monk cadre is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
Kne0fCu271kBT4tl.name: Qi Blast

NWj26RnbvE05Pn1n.description: The monk cadre is practiced at putting their foes off-balance. The monks choose [[/act disarm]], [[/act grapple]], [[/act reposition]], or [[/act reposition]] and attempt an Athletics check to perform that action, comparing the result to the appropriate DC (Fortitude for Grapple and Reposition, Reflex for Disarm and Trip) of each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]. This can result in a different degree of success for each target.
NWj26RnbvE05Pn1n.name: Coordinated Maneuvers

Monk Cadre.name: Monk Cadre

Ofalth Stampede.description: If a large city's waste management system spirals out of control, ofalths can grow and propagate unchecked. These reeking creatures haul tons of trash on their backs and carry a particularly virulent disease.

0fy4J6XGUdXEiXGs.description: The ofalth stampede hurls a tremendous amount of rotting trash, which rains down in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet. All creatures in the area take @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the saving throw are also exposed to wretched weeps. When the troop is reduced to 2 segments, the area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
0fy4J6XGUdXEiXGs.name: Offal Rain

2Fba598q7sUIgo12.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ofalths pummel all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. Creatures that fail the saving throw are exposed to wretched weeps.

1 @Damage[(1d12+3)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(3d12+7)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d12+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage
2Fba598q7sUIgo12.name: Putrid Pummeling

73muWjjVsYKWfZTx.description: A trash stampede gains fast healing 10 when in an area with a high concentration of debris or excrement, such as a refuse heap or sewer.
73muWjjVsYKWfZTx.name: Filth Wallow

i19oaOH6AZhDcAZ9.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d4[bleed]]{2d4 persistent bleed} every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 persistent bleed} every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)
i19oaOH6AZhDcAZ9.name: Wretched Weeps

ySPMm8H8VrhgWl05.description: When an ofalth stampede is not in danger, they can spend 1 minute settling into a 20-foot pile that looks like a heap of garbage. Until the next time they take an action, the troop gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC. A creature that enters the area of the garbage heap or interacts with it must attempt a save against the ofalth stampede's stench.
ySPMm8H8VrhgWl05.name: Refuse Pile

Ofalth Stampede.name: Ofalth Stampede
Ofalth Stampede.npcHp: (4 segments), filth wallow; Thresholds 180 (3 segments), 90 (2 segments)

Omox Slime Pool.description: Omoxes are the embodiment of pollution and filth. While they have no true anatomy, they tend to take on mocking humanoid forms—though this distinction is difficult to spot when omoxes gather in large groups as part of an attacking force. Such a group often looks like a single roiling mass of slime with multiple torsos jutting up in a military formation.

08CBRW38eKM0dQTw.description:
Trigger A creature hits the omox slime pool with a melee weapon

Effect The omoxes attempt to [[/act disarm]] the creature. On a critical success, the weapon becomes subsumed within the body of an omox rather than falling to the ground. Retrieving the weapon requires a successful [[/act disarm dc=45]]{DC 45 Athletics} check to Disarm.
08CBRW38eKM0dQTw.name: Absorb Weapon

2T2SRX4O8jOjVEoq.description: Omoxes embody filth, and they find the concept of cleanliness abhorrent. An omox slime pool subjected to an effect that cleans them takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage. They also take this damage the first time each round a creature damaged by an omox slime pool spends actions cleaning off the resultant filth.
2T2SRX4O8jOjVEoq.name: Clean Vulnerability

2yNNYUWDIamcdzjI.description: The omoxes hurl balls of heavy slime in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet. All creatures in the area take @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning],2d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{4d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d6 acid damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that fails the save is mired in the slime, taking a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute or until it Escapes ([[/act escape dc=38]]{DC 38}); on a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for the same duration. When the slime pool is reduced to 2 segments, the area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
2yNNYUWDIamcdzjI.name: Slime Barrage

R5Bjje08NjUYnNrh.description:
Requirements The omox slime pool has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect Omox slime flows onto the creature, completely covering it. The creature must then succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save or it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} and must hold its breath or begin @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.OiRwxbfLNUniLg15#drowning-and-suffocating]{suffocating}. These effects last as long as the omoxes have the creature grabbed or restrained.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.2u26bmArDPuoCljc]{Effect: Remaining Air}
R5Bjje08NjUYnNrh.name: Smothering Grasp

crLlCiuQimNTxmEK.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The omoxes attack all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with slimy tendrils (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|options:area-effect] save). A creature that critically fails this saving throw is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the slime pool. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+3)[bludgeoning],1d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{1d6+3 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 acid damage}

2 @Damage[(3d6+12)[bludgeoning],2d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{3d6+12 bludgeoning damage plus 2d6 acid damage}

3 @Damage[(4d6+14)[bludgeoning],3d6[acid]|options:area-damage]{4d6+14 bludgeoning damage plus 3d6 acid damage}
crLlCiuQimNTxmEK.name: Waves of Sludge

Omox Slime Pool.name: Omox Slime Pool

Orc Raiding Party.description: Orc raiding parties are feared units whose unrelenting attacks and sheer ferocity make them capable, if not subtle, soldiers. Orc raiders take the duty of carrying their hold's banner into combat with deadly seriousness and will gladly risk grievous injuries to keep their hold's standard flying high.

JmphMuXffisMi4gh.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The orc raiders exploit a gap in enemy lines. The orc raiding party Strides twice; it can pass through spaces of Medium or smaller creatures but can't end its movement in them. All enemies whose spaces the orc raiding party passed through or were adjacent to at any point during their movement take @Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:forced-movement] save). A creature who critically fails this save is also pushed 5 feet away from the orc raiding party. Break Through damages each creature only once.
JmphMuXffisMi4gh.name: Break Through

Mqkq79UBprlR4QUI.description:
The orc raiding party is about to lose a segment due to passing a Hit Point threshold

Effect The dying orc raiders lash out as they fall. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save); this occurs before the raiding party loses a segment.
Mqkq79UBprlR4QUI.name: Ferocious Fall

RfgBo9ONJcGFGDAH.description: The orc raiders launch a multitude of javelins at foes in a deadly volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the orc raiding party is reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
RfgBo9ONJcGFGDAH.name: Iron Rain

pn0H1cy7HVHZUeAM.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The orc raiders batter all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] with coordinated knuckle dagger strikes (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+5)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d6+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
pn0H1cy7HVHZUeAM.name: Rip Them Up

Orc Raiding Party.name: Orc Raiding Party

Protean Tumult.description: Due to the inherently chaotic nature of proteans, many would assume they are incapable of cooperation. However, they are cunning enough to be able to unite in the face of danger or at the behest of more powerful beings, sometimes acting as a group called a protean tumult. Such an association is comprising of dozens of proteans of different shapes and sizes, many of whom continually alter their forms from moment to moment.

JSA3xmys0kWwH0A1.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The protean tumult chooses adamantine, cold iron, or silver; the damage dealt by its Claws, Jaws, and Tails is treated as that material for 1 minute or until it uses Chaos Strike again.
JSA3xmys0kWwH0A1.name: Chaos Strike

JegdZ0GZYtjq4SH8.description: The protean tumult makes their way across the battlefield. It Strides. At the end of this movement, they lash out at the enemy with tentacles and other blunt body parts, dealing @Damage[(2d12+10)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied] save). A creature who fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 2 rounds (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure).
JegdZ0GZYtjq4SH8.name: Stupefying Swipe

R96622IFQ9P9kEle.description: A protean tumult can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} prevents a creature from being detected via entropy sense automatically (without a counteract check).
R96622IFQ9P9kEle.name: Entropy Sense

SaPQIiTXBIDTJjbY.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement}

You ignore circumstance penalties to your Speed.
SaPQIiTXBIDTJjbY.name: Spell Effect: Unfettered Movement (Constant)

e8XD5kcvG2Bx7SOy.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}
e8XD5kcvG2Bx7SOy.name: Protean Anatomy 12

sCHb6Krue4UHWMqU.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The tumult viciously attacks each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d12+1)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d12+10)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d12+11)[untyped]|options:area-damage] damage
sCHb6Krue4UHWMqU.name: Claws, Jaws, and Tails

xySnVB7sWVdq7l75.description: A protean tumult is less organized and more vicious than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to non-protean creatures. A creature that willingly moves into a protean tumult's space takes @Damage[(1d12+1)[untyped]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save); a creature takes this damage only once per round.
xySnVB7sWVdq7l75.name: Chaos Flux

Protean Tumult.name: Protean Tumult
Protean Tumult.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Qadiran Camel Corps.description: Navigating the deserts of Golarion requires trained individuals and often specialized mounts to keep them safe. The Qadiran camel corps are one such example of those who embark on long patrols, hunt down brigands, and dispatch any natural threats that might trouble travelers.

DcjFGhKHKRAVTcD0.description: While moving on land, the Qadiran camel corps ignores the effects of non-magical difficult terrain.
DcjFGhKHKRAVTcD0.name: Trailblazing Stride

Pcfzy3NAiFVVZefL.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The camel corps engages in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+1)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+7)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+11)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage
Pcfzy3NAiFVVZefL.name: Scimitar Assault

R5lNnsguizwqTZFA.description:
Adjusting to the angle of the sun, the camel riders draw their shortbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of an arcing volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). In areas of bright light, such as outside during the day, the targets take a –1 circumstance penalty to the save. When the camel corps is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.owOGKBjP7tlyQD5o]{Effect: Reflective Arrows (Penalty)}
R5lNnsguizwqTZFA.name: Reflective Arrows

eSlfmldt1Fmpwx8f.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the valkyrie tempest, subject to the GM's discretion.
eSlfmldt1Fmpwx8f.name: Mounted Troop

fGsx0orXroWf8pSk.description: A camel corps is well-adapted to heat and deserts. They treat environmental heat as if it was one step less severe, and if the camel mounts have eaten and drank their fill, the corps can Subsist for 1 week without needing to attempt Survival checks.
fGsx0orXroWf8pSk.name: Desert-Adapted Troop

xlepCkCSUhU4WWnG.description:
Requirements The camel corps is in a desert or similar region

Effect The camel corps Steps, whipping up sand into a short-lived storm that obscures the surrounding region. Until the end of their next turn, the camel corps is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from all creatures more than 15 feet away, and all creatures more than 15 feet away are concealed to the camel corps.
xlepCkCSUhU4WWnG.name: Dust Storm

Qadiran Camel Corps.name: Qadiran Camel Corps

4PScM2COzIjHjq0W.description: The ratfolk feint and trip up their foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], attempting a single @Check[thievery|against:reflex] check and comparing the result to each target's Reflex DC. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical success) until they take an Interact action to remove the condition.
4PScM2COzIjHjq0W.name: Dirty Tricks

PFRTcxVCSgkl4Vru.description: The shank squad draws hand crossbows to fire poisoned bolts in a volley. This volley is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet that deals @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[poison]|options:area-damage]{2d6 piercing damage and 2d6 poison damage} with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save. When the shank squad is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
PFRTcxVCSgkl4Vru.name: Poisoned Bolts

XmcGqmrImLqgyZm4.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The shank squad makes a coordinated attack with shivs and daggers against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[slashing],1d4[precision]|options:area-damage]{1d6 slashing damage and 1d4 precision damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+3)[slashing],2d4[precision]|options:area-damage]{2d6+3 slashing damage and 2d4 precision damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+6)[slashing],3d4[precision]|options:area-damage]{2d6+6 slashing damage and 3d4 precision damage}
XmcGqmrImLqgyZm4.name: Shank 'Em

Redcap Brigade.description: Redcaps are sadistic fey known for their merciless bloodlust. When they gather into troops, they goad each other to greater heights of violence.

I03lQeMuxhRMsRtc.description:
Trigger The redcap brigade drops a creature to 0 Hit Points with Bloody Reaping

Effect The redcap brigade performs an additional one-action Bloody Reaping, ignoring the once per round frequency limitation. This does not deal damage to the triggering creature.
I03lQeMuxhRMsRtc.name: Deadly Swipes

KydKNZNQcPHQ3kkf.description:
If a redcap brigade sees a creature brandish a religious symbol of a deity (which requires an Interact action by that creature) or cast a divine spell while wearing a religious symbol, the troop must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. They then become temporarily immune to all brandished religious symbols for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The troop is unaffected.

Success The troop is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The troop is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The troop is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.
KydKNZNQcPHQ3kkf.name: Divine Revulsion

r5WgyRN7xTAUNicy.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The redcaps in the brigade wildly swing their halberds and sickles at each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d10+2)[slashing]|options:area-damage,bloody-reaping-one]

2 @Damage[(2d10+9)[slashing]|options:area-damage,bloody-reaping-two]

3 @Damage[(3d10+10)[slashing]|options:area-damage,bloody-reaping-three]
r5WgyRN7xTAUNicy.name: Bloody Reaping

v9h1oFMfGfVN2Qee.description:
The redcap brigade Strides; they can pass through spaces of Medium or smaller creatures, but can't end their movement in them. All enemies whose spaces the redcap brigade passed through take @Damage[4d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage,bowl-ower-and-stomp] damage and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:26|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save. Bowl Over and Stomp damages each creature only once.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage. If it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, it also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is knocked prone, and takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.
v9h1oFMfGfVN2Qee.name: Bowl Over and Stomp

wPjzApQ4hGBMlw0E.description:
Trigger The redcap brigade loses its first segment, causes another troop to lose its first segment, or is otherwise exposed to copious amounts of blood

Effect The redcap brigade gains a status bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute. The bonus is +2 if they spend one action on Bloody Reaping, +6 if they spend two actions, or +8 if they spend 3 actions. They gain a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with Bowl Over and Stomp.
wPjzApQ4hGBMlw0E.name: Blood Soak

Redcap Brigade.name: Redcap Brigade

DTzsPQI9SG94AmvU.description:

Scamp Inferno.description: Fire scamps are playful and excitable pranksters from the Plane of Fire that have little concept of moderation. When they gather into flocks, unintentional arson is the inevitable result.

85dKljdX45c9ccls.description: The scamp inferno ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.
85dKljdX45c9ccls.name: Smoke Vision

DTzsPQI9SG94AmvU.description:
The scamp inferno attacks with a flurry of tiny teeth and flickering flames. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d4[fire]|options:area-damage]{1d6 piercing damage and 1d4 fire damage}

2 @Damage[(2d6+2)[piercing],2d4[fire]|options:area-damage]{2d6+2 piercing damage and 2d4 fire damage}

3 @Damage[(2d6+4)[piercing],3d4[fire]|options:area-damage]{2d6+4 piercing damage and 3d4 fire damage}
DTzsPQI9SG94AmvU.name: Burning Bites

f2MKhz42yWBSTE9X.description: The scamp inferno breathes flames in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[3d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the save also take @Damage[1d6[persistent,fire]|options:area-damage] damage. The scamp inferno can't use Flame Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Flame Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sinswarm.description: Sinspawn, monstrosities of twisted humanoid flesh, were created ages ago by the runelord Alaznist to serve as shock troops. Hateful even toward their own kind, sinspawn usually band together only in small, isolated cults, although powerful beings are occasionally able to coerce greater numbers of these slavering horrors to join forces as uniquely bloodthirsty and destructive mobs.

89StrKD1wh351i0K.description:
A creature bitten by a sinspawn must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts. The sinswarm can't inflict the same sin effect on multiple targets in the same round until it has inflicted all seven sins at least once.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and takes one of the following additional effects, chosen by the GM:

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute (envy)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (gluttony)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute (greed)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute (lust)

  • @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute (pride)

  • –10-foot status penalty to all Speeds for 1 minute (sloth) @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.9Qyu0HN5j6DO8Izc]{Effect: Sinful Bite}

  • drained 1 and enfeebled 1 for 1 minute (wrath)
89StrKD1wh351i0K.name: Sinful Bite

Zis6FOzrRs7UUXMY.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The sinswarm makes a coordinated attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+9)[piercing]|options:area-damage,sinful-bite] damage plus sinful bite

3 @Damage[(3d8+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage,sinful-bite] damage plus sinful bite
Zis6FOzrRs7UUXMY.name: Sinful Assault

mWL8Pftmb3ar9Dng.description:
Trigger A creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] of the sinswarm uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The sinswarm lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(2d8+9)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save). If the creature critically fails the save and the trigger was a manipulate action, that action is disrupted.
mWL8Pftmb3ar9Dng.name: Reactive Attack

suWuvk3b1IGpa6uN.description: A sinswarm can smell creatures reflecting any one of the seven primary sins as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful.
suWuvk3b1IGpa6uN.name: Sin Scent

Sinswarm.name: Sinswarm

Skeleton Mob.description: To the morbid, a battlefield is no more than a garden of corpses. Sometimes, either through the magic of a necromancer or through an unfortunate pooling of void energy, these bodies rise up as broken and battered skeletons. While some of these skeletons are far from whole, they can still pose a significant threat.

dsHzY2PK1f58ohEV.description: The skeleton mob hurls skulls and fragments of bone in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet. This attack deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the skeleton mob is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
dsHzY2PK1f58ohEV.name: Ossuary Storm

lNAVyJ6NEXycS9N0.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The skeletons engage using their claws and broken bones to attack each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d4+1)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d4+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d4+10)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
lNAVyJ6NEXycS9N0.name: Rattling Bones

Skeleton Mob.name: Skeleton Mob

Vanth Guardian Flock.description: Vanth psychopomps are eternal guardians of the cycle of life and death. When souls are threatened by fiends or other malevolent forces, they gather together to cut the threat down.

5KyfdWPCoXhy15Im.description: The physical damage dealt by the guardian flock's Harvest the Wicked ability is treated as coming from a weapon with a ghost touch property rune. In addition, the vanths deal the listed damage as void damage to living creatures or vitality damage to undead.
5KyfdWPCoXhy15Im.name: Shepherd’s Touch

Czd11iaEfPW4tn8T.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The vanths swing their scythes in a coordinated melee attack. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. The slashing damage is treated as adamantine, cold iron, and silver.

1 @Damage[(1d10+1)[slashing],1d6[untyped]|options:area-damage,item:rune:property:ghost-touch]{1d10+1 slashing damage plus 1d6 shepherd's touch}

2 @Damage[(2d10+3)[slashing],3d6[untyped]|options:area-damage,item:rune:property:ghost-touch]{2d10+3 slashing damage plus 3d6 shepherd's touch}

3 @Damage[(2d10+7)[slashing],4d6[untyped]|options:area-damage,item:rune:property:ghost-touch]{2d10+7 slashing damage plus 4d6 shepherd's touch}
Czd11iaEfPW4tn8T.name: Harvest the Wicked

H19kpPq2dPnbnx8y.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The guardian flock bestows a curse upon all enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] by touching them with their scythes. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33|options:area-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Guardians' Curse for 24 hours.

Success The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.

Failure The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. Each time the target gains the dying condition, the stupefied condition value increases by 1, to a maximum value of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is permanent.
H19kpPq2dPnbnx8y.name: Guardians' Curse

MsKH9CcQ2FUFYARf.description:
Trigger A creature hits the guardian flock with an attack roll

Effect After the attack roll is resolved, the troop pools dimensional magic to rapidly change their position. They cast 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}, except their range is limited to 40 feet.
MsKH9CcQ2FUFYARf.name: Reactive Relocation

Vanth Guardian Flock.name: Vanth Guardian Flock

Viking Guard.description: Battle-tested Ulfen barbarians, hunters, and warriors gather into an elite fighting unit who specialize in offering protection to their leaders in battle as well as protecting those who can afford their services. Traveling far and wide, single troops or entire companies can easily find work based on their reputations, from serving as bodyguards in small private armies to taking on specialized jobs.

2yhFRocgioO4honN.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Battle axes in hand, the viking guard engages in a coordinated melee attack against enemies in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+3)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+12)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+15)[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage
2yhFRocgioO4honN.name: Berserker Strikes

VqEamdyLNKS5oVeS.name: +2 status to all saves vs. fear

dmX23IiV8D4OzC5m.description:
The viking guard designates an ally it can see to be its charge. The charge gains a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC, Reflex saves, and saves against fear when they are adjacent to the viking guard. Further, this allows the viking guard to use its Sacrifice and Shield Wall actions. A viking guard can have only one charge at a time, and if it designates a new charge, the old one loses all benefits. If the viking guard's charge is reduced to 0 Hit Points, the viking guard must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}; this is an emotion, fear, and mental effect.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.qTbVcHLfFDuyJTTG]{Effect: Guard Charge}
dmX23IiV8D4OzC5m.name: Guard Charge

kQKdy0Cda3omnspU.description:
Requirements The viking guard has a charge, and that creature is adjacent to the viking guard

Effect Raising shields, the viking guard Strides up to twice its Speed as it protects its charge. The viking guard gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The viking guard's charge can Stride the same distance as a reaction, moving with the troop to maintain the bonuses from Guard Charge during this movement.
kQKdy0Cda3omnspU.name: Shield Wall

nip3rJMlKAmiJXIk.description:
Requirements The viking guard has a charge, and that creature is adjacent to the viking guard

Trigger The viking guard's charge takes Hit Point damage

Effect The viking guard's charge takes half damage, and the viking guard takes the remainder of the damage.
nip3rJMlKAmiJXIk.name: Sacrifice

Viking Guard.name: Viking Guard

Vordine Legion.description: Vordines are the foot soldiers of Hell, dispatched in vast armies from the iron city of Dis to guard Hell's uppermost layers and crush the enemies of the archdevils who rule there. Indefatigable and pitiless, a legion of vordines strikes with a ruthless precision that commands fear and envy throughout the multiverse in equal measure. Although they usually serve at the command of more powerful devils, such as the tyrannical nessari, every legion also observes a unique internal hierarchy that enables another vordine to assume command at a moment's notice should it become necessary.

1xgyAsJKi4uaGNXT.description: The vordine legion releases a hail of tridents. This hail is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 40 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save). Creatures that fail the saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of the vordine legion's next turn (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} on a critical failure). When the vordines are reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
1xgyAsJKi4uaGNXT.name: Impaling Barrage

jWsj5fbvx0llQW2b.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The vordines of the legion make coordinated melee attacks with their tridents. Each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+14)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
jWsj5fbvx0llQW2b.name: Tines of Dis

tRuKD4xUouitV2n4.description:
Trigger A creature within the vordine legion's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The creature takes @Damage[(2d8+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage|traits:magical,unholy] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] save); this damage has the magical and unholy traits. If the creature critically fails its saving throw and the trigger was a manipulate action, the legion disrupts that action.
tRuKD4xUouitV2n4.name: Reactive Attack

yzekhn0KtjihD2E8.description: The vordine legion Strides, leaving an orderly pattern of burning hoofprints in each square they enter. The hoofprints continue to burn for 1 minute. Any creature on the ground that begins its turn in, or enters a square with, burning hoofprints takes @Damage[2d8[fire]] damage.
yzekhn0KtjihD2E8.name: Burning March

Vordine Legion.name: Vordine Legion

Wight Battalion.description: Wights are malevolent undead, bent on desecrating the holy and determined to cause suffering to all living creatures. A lone wight is dangerous enough, but when compelled to act together, they are a force to be reckoned with. A wight battalion has the potential to curse entire armies, increasing their numbers until they become an unholy tide.

JZsyW5yBoBlflI3F.description:
The wights coordinate melee attacks with the daggers they were buried with. Each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage depends on the number of actions. On a failed save, the creature is also exposed to corrupting spite.

1 @Damage[2d4[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d4+8)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(4d4+14)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
JZsyW5yBoBlflI3F.name: Hateful Daggers

Ze7HYEJOg83Kkcje.description:
The wight battalion's attacks inflict a curse that makes a creature grow weak and spiteful. A living humanoid that dies while under this curse rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.DBTbqI9QQRtlJwWh]{Wight} after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, controlled by the wight battalion that inflicted the curse. This new wight can't inflict corrupting spite and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}. If the creating wight battalion dies or after roughly a month of existence, the new wight becomes autonomous and becomes a normal wight

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and doesn't treat any creatures as allies (1 round)

Stage 3 As stage 2, except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 round)

Stage 4 As stage 2, except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4} (1 round).
Ze7HYEJOg83Kkcje.name: Corrupting Spite

i2hz3lKfdVEcYptB.description:
Each time a creature loses Hit Points due to the wight battalion's corrupting spite curse, the battalion gains 6 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.yeK8zmBJvam75Fp7]{Effect: Fueled by Spite}
i2hz3lKfdVEcYptB.name: Fueled by Spite

lctO2P0MLVpB9WYB.description:
Trigger The wight battalion is about to lose a segment due to Hit Point damage

Effect The wights strike out as they fall. Each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] takes @Damage[2d4[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save). This occurs before the battalion loses a segment.
lctO2P0MLVpB9WYB.name: Final Grudge

Wight Battalion.name: Wight Battalion

Wolf Pack.description: Though wolf packs can be a menace to farming communities that rely on livestock, they prefer not to go after humanoids or other dangerous foes. However, hungry packs don't have the luxury of being cautious.

5RB8yjisQKiw1Gd4.description: The wolf pack focuses all their efforts on biting a single adjacent foe, who takes @Damage[(4d6+8)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). If the creature fails this saving throw, the wolf pack can immediately attempt an [[/act trip]]{Athletics} check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the creature.
5RB8yjisQKiw1Gd4.name: Harry Prey

Z7tomDndmcLrDf68.description:
The wolves work together to fell their opponents. Each enemy within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. A creature who is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for this attack. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+1)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+7)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+11)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
Z7tomDndmcLrDf68.name: Pack Hunt

Wolf Pack.name: Wolf Pack

Xulgath Army.description: Though most xulgath settlements can be found in the Darklands, these reptilian humanoids sometimes venture to the surface with ill intent. When gathered into an army, xulgaths tear through innocent communities in the name of whatever leader they serve.

Sc1M1Q5SwLYfoRIw.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The xulgaths make coordinated melee attacks against each enemy in @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+1)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+7)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(2d6+12)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage
Sc1M1Q5SwLYfoRIw.name: Club Offensive

dFtKZ94VZwUVZGqM.description: he xulgaths draw javelins and launch a coordinated barrage at range. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[3d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the xulgath army is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
dFtKZ94VZwUVZGqM.name: Javelin Barrage

pXqf864qlns57H38.description: The xulgaths concentrate their attacks on a single adjacent enemy, clawing and biting with abandon. That creature takes @Damage[(3d4+5)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). On a failed save, the creature also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,bleed]] damage.
pXqf864qlns57H38.name: Rend Flesh

Xulgath Army.name: Xulgath Army

Xulgath Dinosaur Cavalry.description: Xulgaths have been breeding and training dinosaurs for millennia, and the bonds between them are as familiar and strong as that between any other humanoid and their domesticated companion of choice. While most of the creatures are used primarily as beasts of burden, elite xulgath soldiers known as roughriders train the most vicious and aggressive dinosaurs from numerous species to serve as vicious and terrifying mounts, capable of punching through defensive lines and smashing fortifications to splinters as easily as they scatter enemy soldiers.

EyzM8IsGsCsC2eQu.description: Effects that target only animals or only humanoids may not work on the valkyrie tempest, subject to the GM's discretion.
EyzM8IsGsCsC2eQu.name: Mounted Troop

OA4p28bD8vELnas7.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The cavalry makes a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save. The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(2d6+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(4d6+10)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(5d6+15)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
OA4p28bD8vELnas7.name: Spears, Teeth, and Horns

sh7iK8xqS8cHsays.description: The xulgaths draw javelins and launch a coordinated barrage at range. This barrage is a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet that deals @Damage[4d8[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the cavalry is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
sh7iK8xqS8cHsays.name: Javelin Barrage

Xulgath Dinosaur Cavalry.name: Xulgath Dinosaur Cavalry

Zecui Horde.description: A surprise raid by a swarm of the insectile zecui can easily wipe out an entire village overnight. When they don't devour their victims immediately, zecuis typically implant them with their own larvae and bury them in sprawling mass graves, where the developing zecui horde can lie dormant for years before suddenly erupting to the surface to wreak havoc on nearby settlements.

6qGgXdGTtS0unUby.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The horde makes a vicious bite attack against each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic|options:area-effect] save). The damage dealt depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

2 @Damage[(2d8+12)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage

3 @Damage[(3d8+15)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage
6qGgXdGTtS0unUby.name: Mandible Frenzy

Guwo78TyBNSprkQI.description:
Requirements The zecui horde has burrowed into an ambush position just beneath a surface of dirt, sand, or a similar loose material

Effect The horde bursts from the ground and moves up to its Speed. The horde deals @Damage[(1d8+2)[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save) to each enemy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] at the end of this movement.
Guwo78TyBNSprkQI.name: Subterranean Ambush

PKUSYo3GgYBtftNN.description: The horde spits a volley of larva-infested mucus as a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 30 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:27|options:area-effect,inflicts:immobilized] save or be stuck to the nearest surface, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} ([[/act escape dc=30]]{DC 30}). Any creature so immobilized is exposed to zecui larvae at the end of each of its turns. When the zecui horde is reduced to 2 segments, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].
PKUSYo3GgYBtftNN.name: Mucus Deluge

S8vzntd61NvQwoFv.description: The zecuis fuse their chitin into black metallic shells. The horde gains resistance 10 to all damage (except mental and spirit) until they next take a move action.
S8vzntd61NvQwoFv.name: Harden Chitin

d2LtVhBSBPnv1oh3.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Stage 1 visible lumps as the larvae move but no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and controlled by the zecui larva (1 day)

Stage 5 the creature dies and an adult @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.vVs0N3mcWYHsyccc]{Zecui} can emerge from the corpse as an Interact action.
d2LtVhBSBPnv1oh3.name: Zecui Larvae

Zecui Horde.name: Zecui Horde
